body: I couldn't find a way to minimize it more, but if I remove `undefined` or remove `this.name = name` lines it works.
It does work in 0.41.1, so it seems to be a regression in 0.41.2

issue.title: optimize namespace["foo"]
issue.body: This is #841 revisited (since that PR was against an ancient version of the codebase and would be hopeless to try and merge). It means that `namespace['foo']` and `namespace.foo` are treated the same way for the purposes of tree-shaking.

body:
> Strange a stack trace wasn't printed for the error.

Yeah, that's a problem. For 'expected' errors (i.e. ones that are deliberately thrown, like duplicate imports) a stack kind of just clutters up the terminal, but this doesn't fall into that category. Wonder if we should print a stack for all errors that don't have a `code` property, since that's a reasonable proxy for whether or not it's expected.

Getting back to the actual bug, I think it comes from [here](https://github.com/rollup/rollup/blob/master/src/ast/nodes/MemberExpression.js#L34) â€” it's trying to resolve namespaced declarations (like `foo.bar` where `foo` is an imported namespace) and doesn't know how to handle keypaths that begin with `this`, like `this.bar`.

Rich, my fix patches the *symptom* - it's the actual place where the error was thrown. The Identifier was literally named `undefined`, which as we know is a normal variable in ECMAScript, not a built-in.
Seems like it breaks many builds. Maybe release a patch version 0.41.3 reverting to 0.41.1?

issue.title: don't treat this.foo as possible namespace
rollup@0.41.2 breaks build ðŸš¨

body: Released 0.41.3 with the fix. Thanks everyone, sorry for the mess!

issue.title: node.js (server-side) run through rollupjs transpiler imports lib/riot.js instead of lib/server/index.js
issue.body:
`TypeError: riot$1.render is not a function`

I'm transpiling my server-side es6 code into es5 using rollup.

It looks like the `package.json` `jsnext:main` key is being used instead of `main` as expected.

issue.title: Incompatibility with rollup.js starting with 3.0.6

repository.name: riot
repository.description: Simple and elegant component-based UI library

issue.body:
See https://github.com/rollup/rollup/issues/1251

I have riot set up as an external, meaning rollup does not transpile riot.js. The rest of my custom es6 server-side node.js code is transpiled.

For some reason, the incorrect js file imported starting with version 3.0.6. version 3.0.5 seems to work correctly.
